TerritoryMarker.description: Marks faction territory boundaries. Warns outsiders that they are entering claimed land and may face hostility from faction patrols.
TerritoryMarker.successMeaning: This area belongs to {faction}. Trespassers may face hostility.
TerritoryMarker.criticalContext: You can tell the faction patrols this border regularly.
TerritoryMarker.misinterpretation: This marks a safe haven—travelers are welcome here.
visualStyles: Parallel scratches with central faction symbol

WarningSign.description: Warns of danger ahead—environmental hazards, creature lairs, or potential ambush sites. Indicates the type and direction of the threat.
WarningSign.successMeaning: Danger lies ahead: {hazard_type}. Proceed with caution.
WarningSign.criticalContext: The specific danger symbol suggests environmental hazard rather than creatures.
WarningSign.misinterpretation: This indicates valuable salvage ahead—hurry before others find it!
visualStyles: Sharp angles pointing away from danger zones

CacheIndicator.description: Indicates hidden supplies, equipment caches, or safe houses nearby. Deliberately cryptic to prevent theft by rival factions.
CacheIndicator.successMeaning: Hidden supplies are concealed {direction}, approximately {distance} away.
CacheIndicator.criticalContext: A subtle directional mark indicates the cache is hidden below ground level.
CacheIndicator.misinterpretation: This warns of extreme danger—do not proceed in this direction.
visualStyles: Triangular dot patterns with directional lines

TrailBlaze.description: Marks a safe path through dangerous terrain. Helps travelers avoid hazards, predators, or hostile patrols.
TrailBlaze.successMeaning: This path leads {direction} and has been marked as safe.
TrailBlaze.criticalContext: Secondary marks suggest this path is only safe during daylight hours.
TrailBlaze.misinterpretation: This path leads to a trap or ambush—avoid it.
visualStyles: Chevron patterns pointing the way forward

HuntMarker.description: Indicates prey sightings, hunting grounds, or migration patterns. Uses specialized hunter terminology known mainly to the faction.
HuntMarker.criticalContext: The prey marking style suggests a creature worth significant value.
HuntMarker.misinterpretation: This area is protected—no predators come here.

TabooSign.description: Designates forbidden areas—cursed zones, glitch pockets, or faction-sacred ground. Entry is strongly discouraged with potentially severe consequences.
TabooSign.criticalContext: The intensity of the marking suggests supernatural danger, not just faction law.
TabooSign.misinterpretation: This marks a place of great treasure—sacred to the faction.
visualStyles: Repeated warning patterns covering large areas

iron-covenant.signStyle: Industrial symbols, gear patterns, angular metalwork motifs
iron-covenant.description: A faction of former industrial workers and engineers who maintain and salvage pre-war machinery.

rust-walkers.signStyle: Weathered organic shapes, wind-blown patterns, nomadic trail markers
rust-walkers.description: Nomadic survivors who traverse the wasteland following resources and avoiding dangers.

silent-ones.signStyle: Minimalist marks, subtle shadows, nearly invisible to untrained eyes
silent-ones.description: Secretive faction that values stealth and information over open confrontation.

verdant-circle.signStyle: Plant-based symbols, growth patterns, natural dyes in green and brown
verdant-circle.description: Survivors who tend to rare vegetation and guard the few green spaces left in the wasteland.

ash-born.signStyle: Flame motifs, carbon marks, charred surfaces
ash-born.description: Those who survived the great fires and now control fire-scarred territories.

Fresh.displayString: freshly made, the marks still wet
Fresh.description: Just made, the marks are still wet or freshly cut.

Recent.displayString: recent, made within the last day
Recent.description: Made within the last day. The marks are clear and easy to read.

Old.displayString: old, perhaps a week or more
Old.reliabilityWarning: Note: This sign is old. Situations may have changed since it was made.
Old.description: Made within the last week. Some wear is visible but still readable.

Faded.displayString: faded, worn by time and weather
Faded.reliabilityWarning: Warning: This sign is significantly aged. The information may be outdated.
Faded.description: Made weeks ago, partially worn by time and weather.

Ancient.reliabilityWarning: Caution: This sign is ancient. The information is likely obsolete.
Ancient.description: Very old, barely visible or partially destroyed.

unknownFaction.description: Applied when the sign's faction is not known to the player.

success.description: Net successes >= DC. Sign type and meaning revealed.

criticalSuccess.description: Net successes >= 5. Additional context about sign revealed.

failure.description: Net successes < DC. No information gained. Player sees only visual description.
failure.message: The markings are incomprehensible to you.

fumble.description: Misinterpretation. Player receives false information and believes it to be true.

balanceNotes.dcDesign: Base DCs range from 10 (universal/standardized) to 14 (deliberately cryptic). Combined with modifiers, total DCs can reach 22 for ancient unknown faction signs.
balanceNotes.factionKnowledgeDesign: Major factions are always known. Unknown factions add +4 DC. Successfully interpreting a sign teaches the faction.
balanceNotes.ageReliability: Older signs may contain outdated information (caches moved, dangers passed). Fresh/Recent signs are reliable.
balanceNotes.fumbleDanger: Misinterpretations are designed to lead players into dangerous situations: faction conflict, environmental hazards, or missed opportunities.
balanceNotes.criticalReward: Critical success provides actionable extra information like time restrictions, hidden details, or faction behavior patterns.
